Class dom.util.Queue 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.util.Queue
public class Queue
extends java.lang.Object
implements Enqueable
A thread-safe queue for arbitrary objects.

Provides a deadlock-free way for threads to exchange objects with one another.

NOTE: This queue assumes that there will potentially be multiple producing threads (multiple threads adding to this queue), and one consumer thread (one thread to call the dequeue/peekQueue methods). It does not assume that there will be multiple consumer threads.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis
See Also:
java.lang.Thread

Constructor Detail

Constructor for a queue.
Method Detail

enqueue

public boolean enqueue(java.lang.Object obj)
Add an object to this queue. Multiple threads can add objects to this queue at will, and this method will serialize their placement onto this queue.
Implements:
enqueue in interface Enqueable
Parameters:
obj - the Object to add to the queue

dequeue

public java.lang.Object dequeue()
Wait for something to do. Blocks until something is available from queue. Returns null immediately if the queue is shut down or thread is interrupted.
Returns:
an object previously added to the queue, or null if there is no more work

peekQueue

public java.lang.Object peekQueue()
Look at the top object on the queue (without removing it). Blocks until something is available. Returns null immediately if the queue is shut down or thread is interrupted.
Returns:
an object previously added to the queue, or null if there is no more work

removeFirstElement

public void removeFirstElement()
Remove first element in queue

NOTE: If this method is called directly from user code (rather than via the dequeue method), then the caller must be sure that an element currently exists on the queue (e.g. via the peekQueue method), to avoid throwing a runtime exception.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Check whether this queue currently has an items in it. Returns true if the queue is empty, false if it is not empty.
Returns:
true if empty, false if not empty

stop

public void stop()
Stop this queue. Once called, this queue cannot be reused.

isStopped

public boolean isStopped()
Method for checking whether this queue has already been stopped.
Returns:
true if this queue has been stopped, false otherwise

flush

public void flush()
Flush any/all items from this queue. Unconditionally removes any queue elements.

close

public void close()
Ends processing for this queue. Once this is called, the queue can no longer be used.
Implements:
close in interface Enqueable
